page.title: 13SPITSAND CONTINUED
page.content: Although not yet fully restored to its former glory an enormous amount of work has been completed, including a new landing stage which enabled visitors to embark and disembark in safety. There is a well where fresh water was obtained from a depth of over 400 metres and is still in working order. Also you can see the Victorian cooking ranges, an old forge (which were still in use during World War 2). On the second floor several of the rooms have been converted into a cafe. You can take part in one of the conducted tours and come and lose yourself in a maze of passages and tunnels(the children loved it!)
